title: Psalms 68:1
text: LET God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

title: Psalms 68:2
text: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

title: Psalms 68:3
text: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.

title: Psalms 68:4
text: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.

title: Psalms 68:5
text: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

title: Psalms 68:6
text: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.

title: Psalms 68:7
text: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

title: Psalms 68:8
text: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

title: Psalms 68:9
text: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.

title: Psalms 68:10
text: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

title: Psalms 68:11
text: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.

title: Psalms 68:12
text: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

title: Psalms 68:13
text: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

title: Psalms 68:14
text: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.

title: Psalms 68:15
text: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.

title: Psalms 68:16
text: Why leap ye, ye high hills?  this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.

title: Psalms 68:17
text: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.

title: Psalms 68:18
text: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.

title: Psalms 68:19
text: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation.  Selah.

title: Psalms 68:20
text: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.

title: Psalms 68:21
text: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

title: Psalms 68:22
text: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:

title: Psalms 68:23
text: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

title: Psalms 68:24
text: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.

title: Psalms 68:25
text: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.

title: Psalms 68:26
text: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.

title: Psalms 68:27
text: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

title: Psalms 68:28
text: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

title: Psalms 68:29
text: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.

title: Psalms 68:30
text: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.

title: Psalms 68:31
text: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

title: Psalms 68:32
text: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:

title: Psalms 68:33
text: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.

title: Psalms 68:34
text: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

title: Psalms 68:35
text: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people.  Blessed be God.
